item.title: Sean add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel." -- William Gibson

item.title: Sean add a quote by William Gibson
item.description:
"The future is already here – it's just not evenly distributed.
<i>The Economist, December 4, 2003</i>" -- William Gibson

item.title: Sean add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Sean add a quote by J. G. Ballard
item.description: "In a totally sane society, madness is the only freedom." -- J. G. Ballard

item.title: Sean add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Show some fucking adaptability!" -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Like every other creature on the face of the earth, Godfrey was, by birthright, a stupendous badass, albeit in the somewhat narrow technical sense that he could trace his ancestry back up a long line of slightly less highly evolved stupendous badasses to that first self-replicating gizmo---which, given the number and variety of its descendants, might justifiably be described as the most stupendous badass of all time. Everyone and everything that wasn't a stupendous badass was dead." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Whenever serious and competent people need to get things done in the real world, all considerations of tradition and protocol fly out the window." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "The hour of noon has passed,' said Judge Fang. 'Let us go and get some Kentucky Fried Chicken." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "When you are wrestling for possession of a sword, the man with the handle always wins." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Sean add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Sean add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "First we thought the PC was a calculator. Then we found out how to turn numbers into letters with ASCII — and we thought it was a typewriter. Then we discovered graphics, and we thought it was a television. With the World Wide Web, we've realized it's a brochure." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Sean add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Technological progress has merely provided us with more efficient means for going backwards." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Sean add a quote by Rollo May
item.description: "Technology is the knack of so arranging the world that we do not experience it." -- Rollo May

item.title: Sean add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Computers are useless. They can only give you answers." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Sean add a quote by John Brunner
item.description: "It's supposed to be automatic, but actually you have to push this button. " -- John Brunner

item.title: Sean add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sean add a quote by Marshall McLuhan
item.description: "Our technology forces us to live mythically" -- Marshall McLuhan

item.title: Sean add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "We've arranged a civilization in which most crucial elements profoundly depend on science and technology. We have also arranged things so that almost no one understands science and technology. This is a prescription for disaster." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Sean add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It would be possible to describe everything scientifically, but it would make no sense; it would be without meaning, as if you described a Beethoven symphony as a variation of wave pressure." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sean add a quote by Alfred Korzybski
item.description: "The map is not the territory." -- Alfred Korzybski

item.title: Sean add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sean add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sean add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Never give in. Never give in. Never, never, never, never—in nothing, great or small, large or petty—never give in, except to convictions of honour and good sense. Never yield to force. Never yield to the apparently overwhelming might of the enemy." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Sean add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sean add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Sean add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sean add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sean add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Sean add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light." -- Leonardo da Vinci
